revised_title: High Multiplicity of Stationary-State Solutions in Coupled Reaction-Diffusion and Temperature-Conduction Equations in Spherical Geometry
tldr: This article explores the stationary-state behavior of a first-order exothermic reaction occurring within a porous catalyst. The authors find that the reaction-diffusion equations can have an infinite number of solutions in spherical geometry with Dirichlet boundary conditions. Precise numerical computations reveal the evolution of temperature and reaction-rate profiles as a bifurcation parameter is varied, providing a quantitative confirmation of the qualitative theories. The results show that the stationary-state locus has a high degree of multiplicity, with 13 branches of solutions found for the chosen parameters.
